text: The Indian Heritage Centre illuminated after sunset. The Indian Heritage Centre is a cultural centre and museum in Singapore that showcases the culture, heritage and history of Indian Singaporeans. Located at the Campbell Lane thoroughfare in the Little India precinct, the centre was launched on 7 May 2015. The facade's architectural style is influenced by the baoli (or Indian stepwell), to seek an appreciation of the Indian culture. ==References== Category:Ethnic museums in Singapore Category:Folk museums in Singapore
title: Indian Heritage Centre
